hackathon-description-text: Last year’s Consensus hackathon featured 75+ participants working on solutions in financial infrastructure and financial inclusion. This year we’re seeking fresh and interesting ways to use blockchain technology to solve problems in several new end markets.

hackathon-judges.judge-role: Head of Blockchain Innovation Lab at Allianz
Senior Vice President at Fidelity Labs
Senior Program Manager at Microsoft Azure

hackathon-eligibility:
Participants must be 18 years of age or older, to qualify to win. 
Team size is 1 - 4 participants.
hackathon-requirements:
Signup to rehearse on Saturday. 
Rehearse on Sunday morning.
Submit project and team to Devpost by 1 pm Sunday at the latest.
hackathon-rules:
For up to date rules please see: http://www.coindesk.com/events/consensus-2016/hackathon/
Required in order to be able to have a valid submission and to be able to present to the judges:
Rehearsals will be scheduled in 10 minute slots from 8:30 am - noon on Sunday, May 1, 2016.
You may have up to two slides.
Recommendations: Rehearse your pitch. Spend 30 seconds or less on your slide(s). Spend as much time as possible showing what you built over the weekend.
 
Rehearsal signups will begin Saturday evening, April 30, 2016.
Hackathon Code of Conduct:

hackathon-prizes.prize-title: Consensus2016 Building Blocks Hackathon Grand Prize
Consensus2016 Building Blocks Hackathon Second Prize
Consensus2016 Building Blocks Hackathon Honorable mention

hackathon-prizes.prize-content: Half-day session with Deloitte’s iLab and global innovation group, followed by dinner with Deloitte blockchain leaders and executives. Includes roundtrip airfare (with a maximum value of $500 each) and a one night stay in Atlanta for each team member.
hackathon-prizes.prize-title: Deloitte: App with highest potential for commercialization

hackathon-prizes.prize-content: BlockApps will send you 100 Ether via the Ethereum blockchain

Each team member will receive GoPro HERO4 Silver Camera (up to five per team), recognition on ibm.com/blockchain for 30 days and a half-day IBM Garage Session with IBM Blockchain architects. An additional team will receive GoPro HERO4 Silver Camera (up to five per team).
hackathon-prizes.prize-title: Most innovative use of IBM Blockchain Services Challenge
Most innovative use of IBM Blockchain Services Challenge - Runner Up
Best use of use live.ether.camp blockchain explorer & Ethereum Studio development system

hackathon-prizes.prize-content: One Bitcoin for best use of Tierion technology

hackathon-prizes.prize-title: Microsoft Best Use of Azure Platform for Blockchain

hackathon-location-google-maps: https://maps.google.com/?q=11 Times Square, New York, NY 10036, USA

hackathon-judging-criteria.judging-criterion: Prize: 1/2 session with Deloitte’s iLab and global innovation group, followed by dinner with Deloitte blockchain leaders & executives. Includes roundtrip airfare (with  max value of $500 each) & one night stay in Atlanta for each team member.
Best app using the MSFT Visual Studio Block Azure Stack

Prize: Each team member will receive GoPro HERO4 Silver Camera, recognition on ibm.com/blockchain for 30 days and a half-day IBM Garage Session with IBM Blockchain architects. An additional team will receive GoPro HERO4 Silver Camera.
Prize: $5,000. Runner-up $1,000. Criteria includes: Unique idea, market readiness, tech complexity & presentation.

hackathon-location-address: 11 Times Square, New York, NY 10036, USA
hackathon-description-header: Come build new product and tinker with some of the latest and greatest blockchain infrastructure.  Apply to join us in Times Square.
